derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in senses 2 and 3 ): from late Latin, a technical use of Latin sector 'cutter', from sect- 'cut off', from the verb secare

encyclopedia.content: 函数名： sector 功 能： 画并填充椭圆扇区 用 法： void far sector(int x, int y, int stangle, int endangle); 程序例： #include <graphics.h> #include <stdlib.h> #include <stdio.h> #include <conio.h> int main(void) { /* request auto detection */ int gdriver = DETECT, gmode, errorcode; int midx, midy, i; int stangle = 45, endangle = 135; int xrad = 100, yrad = 50; /* initialize

entry.def: A particular sector of a country's economy is the part connected with that specified type of industry.

example.ex: ...the service sector of the Hong Kong economy.
example.tran: 香港经济中的服务行业

entry.def: A sector of a large group is a smaller group which is part of it.

example.ex: Workers who went to the Gulf came from the poorest sectors of Pakistani society.
example.tran: 前往海湾的工人来自巴基斯坦最贫穷的社会阶层。

entry.tran: 军事管制区;军事防御区
entry.def: A sector is an area of a city or country which is controlled by a military force.

example.ex: Officers were going to retake sectors of the city.
example.tran: 军官们打算重新夺回该市的防御区。

entry.def: A sector is a part of a circle which is formed when you draw two straight lines from the centre of the circle to the edge.

means.word_mean: 1. a plane figure bounded by two radii and the included arc of a circle
2. a body of people who form part of society or economy;
3. a particular aspect of life or activity;

sentences.sentence: "he was helpless in an important sector of his life"

means.word_mean: 4. the minimum track length that can be assigned to store information; unless otherwise specified a sector of data consists of 512 bytes
5. a portion of a military position
6. measuring instrument consisting of two graduated arms hinged at one end
